November Commentary - 2017 GROWTH Commentary Series Global Health Part 6: Global Health Initiative Resolve to Save Lives By Tom Frieden, MD, MPH President and CEO of Resolve to Save Lives Former Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Congratulations to the Global Burden of Disease collaborator network on the release of the 2016 study and 20 years of collaborations and innovations! The Global Burden of Disease (GBD) data collection, analyses, and dissemination involves nearly 2,500 collaborators from across more than 130 countries and territories. The massive effort is masterfully coordinated by the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) at the University of Washington, in Seattle, WA (USA). Doctor Evidence has many staff who are participants in this network. The GBD marked its 20th anniversary late last month with a 3-day series of plenary and panel sessions on the history of the GBD, current challenges, and future plans. Many collaborators and dignitaries, including Bill Gates of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation and Dr. Jim Yong Kim, President of the World Bank, congratulated the GBD network and offered insights into how significantly this data has impacted health and healthcare on local and global scales. If you were unable to attend, you can view the archived presentations. The GBD study has just published its latest global estimates (based on 2016 data) for the state of the world’s health in The Lancet issue published on September 14, 2017. The GBD is the only annual, comprehensive, peer-reviewed assessment of global trends in health, providing global and national estimates on more than 330 diseases, causes of death, and injuries in 195 countries and territories worldwide.

Introducing… ASCO DOC Search Perform a comprehensive search within and across American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) meeting abstracts. Multi-year research will be possible, as meeting abstracts for the past 20 years and all future years will eventually be included in the repository. This technology will also allow researchers to follow the evolution of research from abstracts to published papers, as well as any post-hoc or follow-up studies that use the same study populations. Tracing these linkages helps avoid double counting patients while facilitating complex analyses. Read the press release

The International Society for Pharmacoeconomics and Outcomes Research (ISPOR) 20th Annual European Congress will take place November 4-8, 2017, at the Scottish Event Campus (SEC) in Glasgow, Scotland. ISPOR Meetings are a forum for discussion and dissemination of information surrounding the science of health economics and outcomes research. The goal of the meetings is to bring together experts in the field to share innovative research methods and health policy developments and to provide an opportunity to learn from each other to advance the science. Doctor Evidence will be represented at the ISPOR European Congress by Mir Sohail Fazeli, MD, PhD, Vice President and Head, Consulting Services, Doctor Evidence
